image.altText: A smiling woman holding her smiling son in a house with a white kitchen in the background

props.synopsis: The boy's mother, Sophie Roome, and her family sent a statement to ABC News expressing their "incomprehensible grief" at the loss of their "beloved Rowan".

title.children: Mother and family express 'incomprehensible grief' after 2yo boy killed by father

image.altText: A young man wearing a cap sitting at a park table on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are experiencing an economic crisis that shows no signs of easing — and experts fear it will cause generational inequality to worsen without substantial reform.

title.children: In the midst of an economic crisis, is the government at risk of 'failing young Australians'?

image.altText: The interior of the Singapore Airlines plane

props.synopsis: As the world continues to burn fossil fuels, global temperatures are rising, and turbulence is just another natural phenomenon that's affected by that warming.

title.children: Bumpy skies ahead: why scientists say climate change means more air turbulence

image.altText: Inside the Singapore Airlines flight

props.synopsis: While weather forecasts help pilots react, experts say the turbulence experienced on the Singapore flight was unexpected and rare.

title.children: 'Exceedingly rare': Here's what we know about serious turbulence events

image.altText: A woman poses softly for the camera.

props.synopsis: Sven Lindemann used six knives to stab his girlfriend in front of her young daughter, angered that she wanted to leave the relationship.

title.children: Man jailed for girlfriend's murder had 'problematic gender-based beliefs', court told

image.altText: Melbourne Airport

props.synopsis: A Victorian child has tested positive for bird flu after returning to the country from overseas earlier this year. The Department of Health says transmission to humans is rare.

title.children: A Victorian child returning to the country has tested positive for bird flu following an outbreak of the disease

image.altText: A "no entry sign" blocking the entrance to a farm.

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria says the farm near Meredith, south of Ballarat, is in quarantine and that the variant of the disease is H7N7, the most common strain to occur in Australia.

title.children: Hundreds of thousands of chickens euthanased on Victorian farm as bird flu strain identified

image.altText: Andrew Giles during QT

props.synopsis: A man charged over a stabbing murder in suburban Brisbane earlier this month was released by the Administrative Appeals Tribunal, despite an extensive criminal record.

title.children: Opposition questions release of immigration detainee now charged with murder

image.altText: Composite image of facial reconstruction of man and a shoe.

props.synopsis: After drawing a blank using DNA matching, police release a facial reconstruction of a man whose skeletal remains were found on a grassy hill overlooking a beach in Tasmania — with authorities saying the bones could have been there for up to 50 years.

title.children: Facial reconstruction of skeleton found with black dress shoes on farmland near Hobart released

image.altText: A split image shows a man sitting against a brick wall and two pop-art style illustrations of David Bowie and Freddie Mercury

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Brisbane-based visual artist Nordacious, AKA James Hillier, shares the lesson of "delayed gratification" that he learned from his parents and the irresistible guilty splurge in his shopping trolley most weeks.

title.children: For self-employed artist Nordacious, home ownership still feels like 'a lofty aspiration'. But this is his 'slow and steady' plan

image.altText: A picture of a home with a for sale sign out the front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland landlord says he has been left thousands of dollars out of pocket trying to evict renters who refused to leave after their contract was up, delaying the sale of the house.

title.children: 'I wonder if they understand the carnage': Landlord loses thousands in bid to evict tenants on expired lease

image.altText: A close up shot of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: In using his budget reply to rail against foreign investors buying up existing properties, Peter Dutton almost made a case that could really help first homebuyers.

title.children: Peter Dutton has spelled out the maths on home ownership — and he might have done us a favour

image.altText: George Clooney with a grey beard smiles off camera while his wife Amal Clooney with long brown hair smiles.

props.synopsis: Amal Clooney is arguably one of the most famous faces of human rights law. However, social media users grew frustrated in recent months by what they claimed was her silence on the Israel-Gaza war. Those critics have now been silenced.

title.children: 'Amal Clooney is nowhere to be found': How the famous lawyer silenced her critics on her Gaza stance

image.altText: Cluttered shelves line a wall above a bench lined with black plastic. A blender and kitchen mixer are on the bench.

props.synopsis: The government will ban compounding pharmacists from making replica versions of diabetes drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro, widely used off-label for weight loss, amid public safety concerns.

title.children: 'Risk to public safety': Raid reveals unregulated Ozempic made in filthy conditions

image.altText: Jerry being interviewed with a bandage on his bald head and glasses.

props.synopsis: Passengers detail what it was like on board the flight bound for Singapore, as a British musical theatre group identifies the 73-year-old man who died.

title.children: Terrified passengers texted 'I love you' to families during severe turbulence onboard Singapore flight

image.altText: A woman and man look over finances at their laptop while sitting at a dining table.

props.synopsis: One in six women in Australia experience financial abuse. We share three ways that could increase your financial safety, including the questions you should ask a partner early in a relationship.

title.children: Questions to ask a partner that can protect you from financial abuse

image.altText: An Asian woman with black hair in a gold and black dress smiles in front of a black background

props.synopsis: Don't adjust your screens, it really has been 15 years since Masterchef washed up on our shores. Poh shares what it's like to go from season one contestant to season sixteen judge.

title.children: After 15 years in our lives, Australia is as in love with Poh as ever

image.altText: two men close up

props.synopsis: Independent Sydney MP Alex Greenwich is suing former NSW One Nation leader Mark Latham over an allegedly defamatory tweet posted last year.

title.children: Mark Latham 'went as low as possible' with tweet about Sydney MP, court told

image.altText: Angus Taylor in the entrance foyer at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: The opposition's treasury spokesman made his case for the Coalition's budget proposals at the National Press Club on Wednesday. Take a look back at how the speech unfolded.

title.children: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor paints a picture of a struggling economy at the National Press Club — as it happened

image.altText: Matildas striker Sam Kerr

props.synopsis: The Australian striker was officially ruled out of the Games this week as she recovers from an ACL injury. So who will Tony Gustavsson turn to as the Olympics' 'group of death' draws nearer?

title.children: How will a Kerr-less Matildas tackle their 'group of death' at the Paris Olympics?

image.altText: Food creator Liz Miu smiles behind a stack of clear food storage containers filled with food piled high.

props.synopsis: Food writers share their simple tips to help save time, money and brain space in the kitchen.

title.children: Simple tips to save time, money and stress in the kitchen

image.altText: A tall player in white blocks a shot by a shorter player in purple during an NBA match.

props.synopsis: Victor Wembanyama is the first player in NBA history to make the league's All-Defensive first team as a rookie.

title.children: This 7-foot-4 number one NBA draft pick just became the first rookie ever to make a selective all-star team

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers in the corridors of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The federal treasurer says there is "no equivalence" between the actions of Hamas and Israel's president, after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese avoided saying so yesterday.

title.children: Chalmers says 'no equivalence' between Israel and Hamas leaders, as ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for both

image.altText: A man and a teenage boy take a selfie together on the red carpet.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian teenager has scored a speaking role in what's shaping up to be this year's biggest Hollywood blockbuster, Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga, despite only auditioning as an extra.

title.children: 'I always said I wanted to make my burns worthwhile': Mad Max director casts Tasmanian teen in Furiosa

image.altText: PaTH scheme

props.synopsis: Whenever mass sackings are announced, like the one at Telstra, it's only natural to wonder if it's isolated to one firm or part of a growing trend within corporate Australia.

title.children: Is the Telstra mass sacking a worrying sign of things to come?

image.altText: Several airplane fuselages bearing blue and gold Singapore Airlines branding are visible on the runway of a crowded airport.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 is trading higher after a positive session on Wall Street, while Singapore Airlines apologises for a traumatic flight and the death of a passenger. Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares up, Singapore Airlines apologises for traumatic flight and death of passenger

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Iron ore prices up, good news for Aussie stocks
Eagers Automotive AGM forecasts fortune U-turn 🚗

image.altText: A white utility van with no windows in the back.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian police have increased patrols around schools after reports of students being approached by a man outside southern Tasmanian school grounds in recent days. They have urged the public to report any suspicious activity.

title.children: Man in white van spotted offering lollies to kids outside southern Tasmanian schools, police warn

image.altText: A composite showing a man jump off a boat, an orca fin above water and a man in the water near an orca

props.synopsis: Video shared online shows the man diving from a boat onto two orcas in what has been described as "stupid" and "shocking" behaviour by the New Zealand Department of Conservation.

title.children: 'Genuinely stunned': NZ man fined for 'body-slamming' endangered orca

image.altText: A blonde-haired teenager sits behind the wheel of a small racecar on a racetrack. She is smiling.

props.synopsis: No woman has raced in Formula 1 for nearly half a century but a group of 13- and 14-year-old female racers are making their first moves on a long road that could lead to the top.

title.children: F1 has never had a female champion. This Aussie teen could be the one to change that

image.altText: A police officer points at a woman near a car

props.synopsis: A magistrate has found the 37-year-old constable used excessive force but that he was acting honestly in trying to prevent a breach of the peace and arrest the woman.

title.children: Police officer found not guilty of three aggravated assaults against young woman

image.altText: Two black and white images of two bearded men.

props.synopsis: Constable Hugh Bracken, right, who insisted the infamous bushranger be captured alive, has been shunned by history. Now there's a push to honour his actions.

title.children: 'If you shoot him, I'll shoot you': The hostage who made sure Ned Kelly survived his last stand

image.altText: Nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: Building a large-scale nuclear power plant in Australia would cost at least $8.5 billion, take 15 years to deliver and produce electricity at roughly twice the cost of renewable sources, the country's leading scientific institution has found.

title.children: A nuclear power plant for Australia would cost at least $8.5 billion and take 15 years to deliver, new CSIRO report shows

image.altText: The entrance to a tunnel with a concrete floor, surrouned by industrial equipment.

props.synopsis: It is unclear when the machine will be able to get moving again and if it will impact plans for Snowy 2.0 to begin operations in late 2027.

title.children: Snowy 2.0 faces fresh problems, with tunnel boring machine Florence stuck yet again

image.altText: The back of a woman with curly blond hair standing on the street.

props.synopsis: Homeless services are seeing more employed people accessing their services and say single mothers fleeing domestic violence are particularly vulnerable.

title.children: How single mothers face a 'triple whammy' in the housing crisis

image.altText: A sleepy koala rests on a branch high up in a tree.

props.synopsis: Koalas are easy to identify, but really hard to spot. To help conserve the species, citizen science is being used on a national scale for the first time to collect important information on koala numbers, habitat and health.

title.children: Jackson has done more than 70 koala surveys over three years. He's only found five koalas
